categories.title: Fun & frivolous
categories.description: Not every project should be Serious Business™. Here are some things I’ve done as a creative outlet – a mixture of experiments, learning exercises, and silly things to make people laugh.

projects.name: bl.ocks.org experiments
projects.description: Some visual code art and experiments. Although the cool kids are all using CodePen these days.

projects.name: drone-ver
projects.description: Drone Versioning made easy, but not more sane.

projects.name: Emoji Censor
projects.description: Censor out any emoji characters in a piece of text, either visually or audibly.

projects.name: Numberwang browser extension
projects.description: Turn every web page into an interactive game of Numberwang!

projects.name: yakstack
projects.description: A command-line utility to help you stack your yaks.

projects.name: chuckles
projects.description: A library for creating ventriloquist dummy effects in canvas — because that’s what everyone needs, right?

categories.title: Libraries & scripts
categories.description: Fun’s over! This is where the “proper” projects start, I guess.

projects.name: postcss-gradient-transparency-fix
projects.description: A PostCSS plugin to fix gradient transparency for certain browsers (looking at you, Safari).

projects.name: css-background-parser
projects.description: Parse an element’s CSS background properties to get a list of individual backgrounds.

projects.name: css-animated-properties
projects.description: A simple list of which CSS properties can be animated and how.

projects.name: css-shorthand-properties
projects.description: A simple list of CSS shorthand properties and which longhand properties they expand to.

projects.name: Sublime zoneinfo
projects.description: A Sublime Text package that adds syntax highlighting for IANA time zone database files.

projects.name: VSCode zoneinfo
projects.description: A Visual Studio Code extension that adds syntax highlighting for IANA time zone database files.

projects.name: jQuery nearest element
projects.description: jQuery plugin to find the elements in a page that are closest to (or furthest away from) a particular point or element, based on pixel dimensions.

projects.name: jQuery content size
projects.description: jQuery plugin to get the real dimensions of an element’s children, which don’t always match the parent’s width and height.

projects.name: jQuery easing repeater
projects.description: A simple way to speed up and repeat an easing function multiple times over the course of a single animation call.

projects.name: Double the 30-over score
projects.description: A cricket analysis investigating whether an old maxim holds up to statistical scrutiny.

projects.name: Daylight saving rules around the world
projects.description: An overview of all the different times of the year when countries and regions use daylight saving time.

projects.name: Open new tab here
description: Open a new tab next to the one you’re viewing, via a button or a keyboard shortcut.

projects.name: Airport code explainer
description: Explain any IATA airport codes in a web page to avoid having to look them up. Especially useful when using Twitter.

projects.name: Emoji censor
description: Redacts all emoji characters on a page, replacing them with black boxes.

projects.name: Can I Animate...?
projects.description: Like “Can I Use” but for CSS animations. Find out which CSS properties can be animated and get details of how they animate.

projects.name: Background image layers
projects.description: Interactive breakdown of how browsers render multiple CSS backgrounds on a single element.

projects.name: Gradient Circus
description: An overview of what CSS gradients can be used for, as well as the mathematics of how they work.

projects.name: Time zone of your life
description: Take a journey into the weird and wonderful (horrible) world of dealing with time zones in software, and learn how I screwed it up.

projects.name: Ease yourself into animation
description: A primer on how easing works in animations and how it’s coded in various JS frameworks.
